intro: Cynoglossum zeylanicum var. lanceolatum, commonly known as Indian forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological biodiversity.
